instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: [<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>] <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Capacitor Replacement
threads.message:
[MEDIA=youtube]p5ROyf2Un9E[/MEDIA]
I need some help knowing a) what is the spec on the capacitors that Louis replaced and b) where can I buy them. I know that there are capacitor books available from the online store but I am not sure which book contains the capacitor I need.

threads.title: [<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>] <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Capacitor Replacement
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

For the future, post component location in schematic; easier and faster than watching a video.
Also posting 820-xxxxx code of the board in title is a basic rule.

Considering <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, <CAPACITOR>C6405</CAPACITOR>/16 are both 10uF/25V.
You should get them from scrap boards.
I doubt you can find correct value and size (0603) in a capacitors book.

threads.title: [<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>] <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Capacitor Replacement
threads.message: Thank you for the instruction. I appreciate the help.

threads.title: [<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>] <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Capacitor Replacement
threads.message:
Thanks! I'll try to remember the rules going forward.

I did some searching and found this capacitor ([URL='https://www.mouser.com/ProductDetail/Kyocera-AVX/CM105X5R106M25AT?qs=sGAEpiMZZMsh%252B1woXyUXj8lWL9%252Bq1p6jesBpCajBhKo%3D']CM105X5R106M25AT[/URL]), would this possibly work? I'm very new to reading schematics and data sheets but it seems like it matches up with the specs you had listed.

threads.title: [<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>] <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Capacitor Replacement
threads.message:
Looks perfect.
You should consider to make scrap board stocks, if plan to stay in this business.
Is the only way to get SMCs, for example.
The rest of the boards (no CPU/RAM, nor GPU) bought on Aliexpress/eBay, serve for caps, MOSFETs, ICs...
